content:
The answer here depends on if your mediacom mail is an IMAP account or POP.

POP is local storage, IMAP is not once the account closes.

Contact are generally stored locally, but they can be synced to say google contacts.

I would start by just adding your google gmail account to Thunderbird right now. you do not have to wait as Thunderbird can have loads of accounts configured, I have more than 20.

Once you have that up an running we can look at the rest of your needs.

content:
If they are important, I hope you have a backup. If you do, you may want to create a NEW profile and import everything into the NEW profile and see if everything is intact.

Before I do anything, I usually do a computer check-up. as well as scan with Malwarebytes and My Antivirus to be sure the systems in shape. If you want some step-by-steps on that I can post them in a follow-up.

I can also give a step-by-step to create a new Profile to import your backup or current one, just to see if that may help solve the issue or find the problem.

I am able to choose multiple emails in a row but Clicking First Email, then holding the SHIFT KEY down when I select the LAST one. Then clicking the highlighted area and move them, or right-click on it to do another function to them.

IF it's to select Random EMAILS, Hold the CTRL Button down and keep it down as you select Individual emails.

I tried it and it works for me, even on JUNK emails....

When highlighted, just click JUNK again and it will Unselect them.

Good Luck!

content: That comment might confuse the original poster. In Thunderbird, the selection of 'variable fonts' in composing HTML message means that NO FONT selection is embedded in the outgoing message. This allows the recipient's email client to define the font that is used. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content:
Variable fonts are a relatively new technology that allows for the adjustment of various attributes of a font, such as weight, width, and slant, in a seamless and continuous manner. These fonts offer greater flexibility and control over typographic design compared to traditional static fonts.

When it comes to using variable fonts in email, there are a few considerations to keep in mind:

Email Client Support: Variable fonts are not universally supported across all email clients. While some modern clients may support variable fonts, others may not render them correctly or at all. It's crucial to check the email client compatibility before incorporating variable fonts into your email design.
creator: techguy150

creator: seedwards

content:
I assume you're writing in plain text. To ensure your text is the right font and size, there are a few steps Okay, this may sound strange, but here is the real way to set fonts on Thunderbird. And I attached examples of my own setting of Calibri 14 as my default. Here goes: 

- in Tools>settings>general, set your default font.  - then click the advanced button. Notice the drop-down menu at top. It probably says 'latin' or 'other writing systems' - this is IMPORTANT:  - select 'latin from that menu, set your desired font and font size settings, click OK,  - select 'otherwritingsystems' from the drop-down menu and set the IDENTICAL settings to what you did for Latin, and then click OK. In attached screenshots you will see my latin and otherwritingsystem match.  Notice I also set monospace font. - and, if you have account set to compose HTML, then set that in tools>settings>composition to variable-width and medium font. (You would only change the HTML font setting if your intent is for recipient to receive your preferred font - not my personal recommendation.) - Set Sending Format to 'automatic'

With these settings, your compose window and your sent folders will match. And if you don't write HTML (e.g., bold, italic, color), none will be sent . If you do these settings once, your font will always be consistent. This does not protect you from someone sending you a message in some god-awful font with 30 pt size, but this does provide consistency.

Note: The settings are pixels, not points, so you may need to set a higher number than anticipated.
creator: davidsk
